review_text: we stayed here for two nights and absolutely loved it! i am a city slicker - don't know a llama from an alpaca and am really wanting to spend more time around farm animals now. the animals were all so fun to watch and listen to - there was a lot of rain on our second day and we sat for hours on the porch and watched neighboring horses just mill around. lovely. the kitchen and bathrooms were spotless, the beds comfortable and the living room well appointed for curling up and talking or watching TV. would reserve this home again anytime i was in waco.

name: Tim
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
April 2024
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: This place is quiet and peaceful. The home has everything you need to accommodate your stay. Plenty of towels, and well stocked kitchen. Watching the sunset from the porch was definitely a favorite part of our stay. THE FARM ANIMALS! Lucy the Llama was such a delight, as were all the goats and their babies. The geese randomly waddle through the yard letting you know they are there. The neighboring horses are also very friendly and will allow you to feed them grass, and pet their heads. You can walk the street as there is very little traffic, and it is very safe. If you take an evening stroll you will find views of the lake, miniature donkeys, and a miniature pony down the street from the home. Such a delightful retreat here in Waco. Close enough to town for anything you need, yet in a country quiet setting. It was just what we needed!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Our stay at Josh's Rustic Farmhouse was just perfect. The house was very comfortable. The kitchen was awesome...big refrigerator; very nice stove; wonderful pantry with essentials for cooking; very nice dishwasher and lovely back porch for eating and visiting with friends while watching the farm animals.
We loved sitting and having coffee on the front porch rocking on the rocking chairs. Loved walking the lane in front of the house and admiring the beautiful homes and neighboring horses. The farm animals were the highlight of our trip even though our trip was to visit Magnolia. Josh was Johnny-on-the-spot with his responses to any questions we had. My friend who I was concerned about staying in the country said if I ever come back to Waco, I want to stay here. Lucy the Llama, Harry the horse as well as the "bully" goat with the beautiful blue eyes highlight our memories. Thank you, Josh, for a wonderful trip.

Josh was extremely nice and communicated well. He even offered to let us check in a little early.
The place was ideal for our needs! The pastoral views from the kitchen were especially lovely! There are chickens, geese, goats (some adorable baby goats), one alpaca and a horse behind the back fence. Josh had a container with food to feed the chickens and geese. All come running when youâ€™re at the back fence.
We were in Waco for the Homestead Heritage Fair so we didnâ€™t get to sit on the porch in the rocking chairs; maybe next time. And, thereâ€™s a nice back deck with a table and chairs also.
The Mammoth site is just down the road and we were within 20 to 30 minutes of everything we needed to get to.
There were four of us counting my son and daughter in law and we had plenty of room; plus they brought their dog. The beds were very comfortable!
We hope to stay again!

review_text: Absolutely peaceful! We recently stayed during the New Year's weekend. From the moment we stepped on the property until the moment we left, Josh was the best host. He was kind, responsive, and very helpful. I now understand why so many of the reviews spoke of the animals. As soon as we arrived, we couldn't help but rush over to meet them. Feed was left on the patio table and we couldn't wait to feed them. My husband and I were looking for a place to get away and have some downtime. This place was just perfect for that. We loved the outdoor sounds of animals and New Year's fireworks in the distance. We grilled and enjoyed the fire pit. Josh even provided us with the firewood. The house itself was quaint and simple. There was plenty of room to enjoy the t.v. and the quiet time indoors. Everything we needed from kitchen items to bathroom linens was available. It was just my husband and I, but a family of more than two would be just as comfortable there too. We can't wait to return!

review_text:
My girlfriends and I stayed for 1 night to celebrate my birthday, and we were all so amazed at how soft the sheets were and how comfortable the beds were. (Two of my friends are pregnant, so being comfortable in a bed is no small order!)
I may be a bit biased as I was involved in the design of this airbnb, but I have not been involved on the hosting side of things since it opened up, and I wanted to experience it as a guest firsthand to make sure everything was going well.
I have to sayâ€¦.I am very proud of how Joe (my father in law) has created wonderful systems to make staying here a breeze!
It smelled AMAZINGGGG when I walked inside. Fresh and clean and crisp. His wonderful housekeeper does an A++ job making sure the beds are fresh, the coffee is stocked, and everything is immaculate upon arrival!
To design a space is one thing. To operate a business is another thing entirely. Joe has done an amazing job! (Iâ€™m a proud daughter-in law)
My one critique: there was no sugar or honey to sweeten the coffee. Iâ€™m a bit of a wimp and take my coffee sweeet! After a quick chat, he brought some sugar over and I was able to have some coffee with my sugar! ;)
10/10 recommend this guest haus for your next stay.
(Psâ€¦. Love you, Dad!)

Extremely relaxing and peaceful atmosphere. Very clean and detailed perfectly. Amenities are well thought out, readily available and professionally labeled for use.
Recommendations would be to place a label on the front door key pad entry device informing occupant to turn the small deadbolt below the keypad after entering the code. Also, place a label on the porch fire pit informing occupant that the lighting instructions are in the closed compartment area below. Joe was an excellent host. On a few occasions we contacted him with questions and he responded immediately with accurate and concise answers. All in all, this is a real winner as a comfortable BnB. Highly recommend this for anyone looking to have a special quiet country time away, while still being easily accessible to the city. The Swiss decor theme for this BnB is spot on. Thank you Joe for a very special and relaxing stay.

The surprisingly expansive hideaway of the 3 treehouses behind Tammy and Coach's home was amazing! I would imagine it would be a bit tricky to find the place if you were showing up after dark though. But Tammy gave great instructions on how to navigate their unique little "neighborhood."
Our family had a much needed, quiet and peaceful stay to unwind from work and before the boys went back to school.
Our 3 boys really enjoyed exploring the property! We were greeted by Chocolate Chip, the house horse! That was absolutely thrilling for my boys!
The house was so well set up and cozy with such great attention to the smallest details.
We were originally booked to for the Coach's Quarter house but Tammy suggested since we were a family of 5 we'd be more comfortable in the Clubhouse. It was perfect!
We will definitely be back again....when it's cooler and the river is flowing!
Thanks

I can't imagine a better place to stay in Waco! First, it was off in the wooded back-yard acreage of a VERY upscale neighborhood, along a beautiful creek. We felt so secluded, yet very safe. The pictures show you how beautiful the place is. They had the fridge stocked with drinks, and the counter stocked with snacks. The 3 beds were comfortable. We met Gary twice as he came to feed horses. He even offered (and we accepted) a tour of the pastures on his Kawasaki Mule. We got to see their 5 day old longhorn and 10 day old mini horse! Their dog, Sam was a ham, stealing the alfalfa cubes from the horses. We felt like we were staying with old friends. It was a fantastic experience!
THANK YOU!
Sic 'em Bears!
Koehler Family

The accommodations are magnificent with truly comfortable beds, lovely bedding all around, loft and great room with spectacular windows with zebra blinds, huge rain shower area with sparkling shades of blue tile, fantastic AC, Keurig coffee maker and snacks provided that my grandchildren loved, two fascinating miniature horses, and high-end details all around. As I sit here at my computer at home, I wish I was still there and can't wait to go back for more peace and relaxation in the Fall!

name: Audrey
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
June 2021
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
This is without a doubt the coolest AirBnB we have ever stayed at. The amazing Tammy and Coach have created something truly magical. Coach's Quarters by the Creek is stunning in every way. To quote our 6 year old's vocabulary, this getaway is "epic, extraordinary, next level, and wonderful." That last one really resonates because every thoughtful inch has been handmade and designed by a beautiful couple full of love and wonder. From the homeplate at the base of the ramp that makes you feel like a winner every time you step on it, to the gorgeous views of the enchanting neighborhood with a flowing creek clear enough to spot the little fish swimming by, to the relevantly designed gym wood floors, to the artistic mosaics, to the luxurious rain shower, to the whimsical indoor "outhouse", to the perfectly Feng shui'd and uber comfortable furniture, to the masterfully placed windows that maximize natural light and achieve serene privacy, to the charming, character filled knickknacks and heartwarming decorations, this family designed and built custom treehouse is truly the epitome of wonderful.
Yet if that wasn't enough, on the property are two of the friendliest miniature pony sisters, Chocolate Chip and Oreo. They followed our daughter and loved on her from the very first minute she stepped out of the car. Then there's the sweet treehouse pup, Sam, who loves the back rubs and makes sure everyone is safe and well. Lastly and most importantly, you have the most gracious, passionate, and deserving hosts you can find. The level of artistry, passion, discipline, precision, elegance, and joy that Tammy is famous for delivering with her choirs is quite tangibly present and alive in her treehouse.
Honestly the only negative thing is that this place is pretty much booked every weekend in the foreseeable future, but if you can snatch up some dates, don't hesitate. It is worth every penny, and it is still incredibly underpriced. Most treehouses in Texas are at least double what this rare gem is being listed as, and that won't last long because AirBnB controls part of the price regulation so book your next getaway here as fast as you can!

I stayed at the Barkley house for one night on a work trip. The airbnb is a private questhouse behind a home. This was my first stay in an Airbnb, and I was nervous because Iâ€™m a very private person. I travel for work and my nephew encouraged me to try something new.
I couldâ€™ve easily missed the property, but Micheleâ€™s directions made it easy to find. The neighborhood is lovely. It was less than a five minute drive from work, and near the lake, hospitals and shopping centers. To access the airbnb you have to climb stairs. This is clearly depicted in the pictures, but Iâ€™m pointing this out for travelers who may have heavy luggage or mobility issues. Accessing the place was easy; thereâ€™s a coded keypad on the door that was easy to use. The space was beautiful. Itâ€™s one large room which was plenty for my needs. It was clean, uncluttered and smelled nice. The water pressure in the shower was great, linens comfortable. The internet was spotty, but didnâ€™t bother me much. Overall great stay.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Despite having a hiccup when I arrived, Cameron & Danielle made sure I was taken care of. Their home & neighborhood (just like Waco, in general) is a little old & worn but that's what gives it its character. The neighborhood isn't the nicest but after pulling into the driveway & having my own space to park & walk into, all my worries disappeared. I came on this trip alone & not once did I feel unsafe in their home. I loved that their home was so close to everything & downtown! Bed was super comfy & it was nice to be able to watch tv after a long day. It was super hot in Waco & the AC worked perfectly. Shower pressure wasn't the best but did it's job. The room was nice, clean, quiet & quaint. I also got a lucky chance to meet the dog, didn't catch his name, he was too busy chasing squirrels running up trees but he was super friendly. Thank you for making my visit welcoming. I loved this little space & would absolutely stay here again!

review_text:
My husband and I had a great stay at Cameronâ€™s place! We were in Waco for my graduation at Baylor and it was a great spot to stay to be close to downtown and the Baylor campus. Their home has everything that we needed and for the price was a great deal!
One of the things I really appreciated was the fridge had filtered water. Iâ€™ve been to many Airbnbâ€™s that donâ€™t have that, and it was great to not have to buy water.
Another great amenity was having AC and a fan in the home. We visited when it was 106 degrees!! But the AC held up and worked perfectly! The unit can be a little confusing to navigate so it may be useful to get instructions from the hosts.
The only thing to note is we did have some issues with the shower being inconsistent with the hot and cold temperatures. However, the hosts were informed of this issue and are responsive and seem dedicated to resolve any problems.
Overall our stay was great and I would 100% recommend to anyone looking to visit Waco â˜ºï¸

The only recommendation to those staying at the Wishing House would be to consider renting a car if you didnâ€™t drive. There is still a lot to see in the Waco area, and having a vehicle to get around would be helpful. (We used Uber which was easily available, but not as handy)

Stayed a few nights
review_text: We thoroughly appreciated the wonderful house and property, especially our host and all her communication, and the extreme cleanliness of everything. I'm an OCD germaphobe, so I am extremely grateful!! The instructions were crystal clear, and host responsiveness exceeded any expectations we could have had. The location was super convenient to activities, so you really don't need a car if you plan to stay in downtown Waco. We felt safe as not much foot traffic. With exception to an occasional train or weekend music on occassion from Backyard Grill, the location is extremely quiet and peaceful. And, they have ear plugs if you're a bit sound sensitive or a light sleeper. They truly thought of everything, so we really felt like it was home away from home. We were able to relax and work without being in each other's way. This was our first Airbnb experience, and we were spoiled. It will be painful to stay in a hotel going forward, and the bar is extremely high for all other Airbnb's and their hosts. Thank you Bethany and Andrea for a phenomenal experience in Waco!!

review_text:
It was really cool to stay in an actual Fixer Upper house that Chip and Joanna had worked on! The main area they remodeled was absolutely beautiful! And what they couldnâ€™t remodel was painted and refreshed and looked very nice! Itâ€™s an older house obviously, but it was the experience we were there for.
It was very clean and well appointed! Very roomy and lots of rooms for sleeping! The beds were comfy and we enjoyed our stay!
Something to know that surprised us a little was that they also rent out a cottage that is right behind the house. It was not a problem at all and we didnâ€™t see anyone. But just know that the cottage is right outside the back door, almost like a detached garage. It never posed an issue of any kind and we didnâ€™t see the people that were staying there at all. But they would be walking up the driveway past the kitchen window if they were there. Not a deal breaker at all, just a heads up so you arenâ€™t surprised!!
I wish we had time to watch the episode of Fixer Upper but we were only there one night and were exhausted from our early morning flight and the day spent at Magnolia.
Make reservations at Magnolia Table way ahead of time! It is amazing!! Absolutely delicious!! Highly recommend!!
All around great stay! Would stay again!!

review_text: Jeff & Saraâ€™s house is a great place to stay in Waco, especially for larger groups! The location is quiet and relatively close to many amenities. The kitchen and living are the nicest and best parts of the home, and it was enjoyable to spend time there. The one main criticism I have after staying there is that I feel like the bathrooms could use some updating to bring them up to the same level as the rest of the home. The bathrooms are clean and thereâ€™s absolutely nothing wrong with them, but they just fall flat compared to the rest of the house (they feel more like youâ€™re in a clean, but slightly outdated home, rather than any sort of vacation retreat). Overall, I would recommend this property if youâ€™re a fan of Fixer Upper or want to stay in a larger home in Waco!

Group trip
review_text: Staying at the German Schmear house MADE our whole trip! It was perfect for our girls week/40th birthday celebration! We loved being within driving distance to Magnolia and the Silos. We enjoyed everything about our visit to Waco and all agreed that getting to come back to such a special home, during our down times, was one of the highlights. Throwing on sweats and curling up on the couch to watch episode 9 of season 3...you have to watch the episode of Fixer Upper while you are there! We kept pausing it to stop and look around at the real thing. The home is so welcoming and set up so comfortably. We made sure to cook some dinners at the house and enjoyed eating together around the dining room table. We did the Waco Tour towards the end of our stay, but highly recommend it for doing at the beginning of your stay, if possible. The beds were comfortable, the kitchen was well stocked, check-in was a breeze and our hosts were super nice. You won't regret making this part of your stay in Waco. We definitely didn't!

The house is styled very nicely, is clean, has a valuable kitchen space, many rooms, bathrooms, big backyard and amenities. The only downsides were that the back door is difficult to shut/lock, driveway is a little tight, upstairs old wooden floors tend to be noisy and the downstairs masterâ€™s bathroomâ€™s main lights donâ€™t turn on. For us, not huge deal breakers. Other than that, worth the stay and hope to come again on our next trip to Waco!

Air conditioning isnâ€™t accurate and we were freezing while the house was set to 73, but 74 produced a sauna. Overall not a pleasant experience, and when the cockroach issue was pointed out to the hosts, they interrogated me even after I provided VIDEO EVIDENCE. review_text: Jeff & Sara's home is really exceptional. We booked an extended stay in Waco to be closer with family during the pandemic and provide our 1yr old daughter with a backyard to play. This beautiful home was a perfect choice for many reasons. It is stylish without being stuffy. The space functioned well as we cooked every meal, held work calls, entertained our daughter, and relaxed in the evenings. The full-size crib ensured that our daughter slept well and we enjoyed the thoughtful touches of luxury around the house. Having grown up in Waco, I knew exactly what neighborhoods would work for our needs but this particular street really impressed. There are large trees throughout the neighborhood ensuring shady walks and lots of beautiful homes. The neighbors are super sweet and we received lots of waves and "howdy's" on our evening strolls. Jeff & Sara were quick to respond when an overnight thunderstorm knocked out the wifi for a couple hours and we had no problems finding everything we needed during our stay. I can't say enough great things about this home and hosts. Highly recommended.

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We are here on April 21-23, 2023. We thought we were late for wild flowers season, but there are wildflowers right on the property and short driving distance. The flock of hens came to welcome us when we arrived. Check-in was at ease. plenty of space as shown in the pictures. This place fits best for 2 persons. The owner provides extra linen for my son to sleep on the comfy couch. Bed is super comfortable. There are kitchen, sink, coffee machine, refrigerator, microwave. So you could do some cooking here. Restroom is big and clean with cowboy decor. There are washer / dryer if you need to use it as well.
During our stay, we saw 2 cows, 2 horses, lots of hens, and a night clear sky. We enjoy stargazing at night.
There is a nice camper right on the property that belongs to the same owner if your family and friends need extra space. You could do the campfire too, but check with the owner first.
We got some fresh eggs and cook for breakfast along with some oatmeal too.

This was a really, really great stay. Visited Waco with some family for the eclipse and initially was having trouble finding an Airbnb. Luckily found this gem after a handful of other post-booking host cancellations. Cory was communicative about the instructions for the house and we found the entire space to be super clean and spacious for four adults.
We also very much appreciated the fully stocked cooking and coffee supplies in the kitchen. Cupboards full of great dish ware, utensils, and cooking/baking tools.
Wacoâ€™s a pretty quiet town but this spot is just a short drive away from restaurants, quick food, and the Magnolia branded area. We loved it and would certainly stay again if we found ourselves in Waco!

What I liked about the space, it was very light, airy and open. There was a super fun triple bunk room with lights and outlets for each bunk. We had everything we needed in the kitchen to cook breakfast daily. Loved the air fryer, there was also a nice coffee bar with coffee creamers and sweeteners, by the dining table. It was a lovely place and we will stay here again the next time weâ€™re in town.

check in and check out was so easy, and it's always nice when hosts don't ask you to do 20 things before check out. If I'm ever back in waco, I'll definitely book with these fantastic hosts again.
